1.text: Listen, my sons, to a father’s instruction; pay attention and gain understanding.

2.text: For I give you sound teaching; do not abandon my directive.

3.text: When I was a son to my father, tender and the only child of my mother,

4.text: he taught me and said, “Let your heart lay hold of my words; keep my commands and you will live.

5.text: Get wisdom, get understanding; do not forget my words or turn from them.

6.text: Do not forsake wisdom, and she will preserve you; love her, and she will guard you.

7.text: Wisdom is supreme; so acquire wisdom. And whatever you may acquire, gain understanding.

8.text: Prize her, and she will exalt you; if you embrace her, she will honor you.

9.text: She will set a garland of grace on your head; she will present you with a crown of beauty.”

10.text: Listen, my son, and receive my words, and the years of your life will be many.

11.text: I will guide you in the way of wisdom; I will lead you on straight paths.

12.text: When you walk, your steps will not be impeded; when you run, you will not stumble.

13.text: Hold on to instruction; do not let go. Guard it, for it is your life.

14.text: Do not set foot on the path of the wicked or walk in the way of evildoers.

15.text: Avoid it; do not travel on it. Turn from it and pass on by.

16.text: For they cannot sleep unless they do evil; they are deprived of slumber until they make someone fall.

17.text: For they eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.

18.text: The path of the righteous is like the first gleam of dawn, shining brighter and brighter until midday.

19.text: But the way of the wicked is like the darkest gloom; they do not know what makes them stumble.

20.text: My son, pay attention to my words; incline your ear to my sayings.

21.text: Do not lose sight of them; keep them within your heart.

22.text: For they are life to those who find them, and health to the whole body.

23.text: Guard your heart with all diligence, for from it flow springs of life.

24.text: Put away deception from your mouth; keep your lips from perverse speech.

25.text: Let your eyes look forward; fix your gaze straight ahead.

26.text: Make a level path for your feet, and all your ways will be sure.

27.text: Do not swerve to the right or to the left; turn your feet away from evil.
